channel.title: Editing Server [508]
channel.description: What Files Do I Go Into TO Edit Names Of a 508 server?

item.title: Editing Server [508]
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:4, topic:236754”]well, I dont know how to make it ‘Start Out’ with all 99’s but… I can make a case in ObjectOption1 that allows you to automatically get all 99’s by pressing the hay barrel.
If you dont already have this command, add it. If you DO have it, make sure there the right coords.

else if (cmd[0].startsWith("train")) { p.setCoords(3256, 3433, 0);

Next, Open ObjectOption1 in the Packets folder and add this case.

[code] case 299:
p.requestAnim(433, 0);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 1);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 2);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 3);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 4);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 5);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 6);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 7);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 8);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 9);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 10);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 11);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 12);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 13);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 14);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 15);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 16);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 17);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 18);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 19);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 20);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 21);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 22);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 23);

            p.frames.sendMessage(p, "A present to my users! your maxed out! Lvl 138! -Tony");
        break;[/code]

Then compile. If it says that its a ‘duplicate case’ when you compile, it means you already have another case 299. Delete the old one and then go to ::train. When you click the hay barrel, yo’ll have all 99’s. Hope this helps.

EDIT soz! lol forgot the command XD[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 14, 2008, 08:59:51 pm[/size][hr]Edited it. Forgot the command at 1st :P[/quote]

train commands+obj train=fail

Anyway, you any good at 508? Hit me up on MSN I think I have you.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing Server [508]
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

well, I dont know how to make it ‘Start Out’ with all 99’s but… I can make a case in ObjectOption1 that allows you to automatically get all 99’s by pressing the hay barrel.
If you dont already have this command, add it. If you DO have it, make sure there the right coords.

else if (cmd[0].startsWith("train")) { p.setCoords(3256, 3433, 0);

Next, Open ObjectOption1 in the Packets folder and add this case.

[code] case 299:
p.requestAnim(433, 0);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 1);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 2);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 3);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 4);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 5);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 6);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 7);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 8);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 9);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 10);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 11);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 12);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 13);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 14);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 15);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 16);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 17);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 18);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 19);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 20);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 21);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 22);
p.addSkillXP(15000000, 23);

            p.frames.sendMessage(p, "A present to my users! your maxed out! Lvl 138! -Tony");
        break;[/code]

Then compile. If it says that its a ‘duplicate case’ when you compile, it means you already have another case 299. Delete the old one and then go to ::train. When you click the hay barrel, yo’ll have all 99’s. Hope this helps.

EDIT soz! lol forgot the command XD[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 14, 2008, 08:59:51 pm[/size][hr]Edited it. Forgot the command at 1st

item.title: Editing Server [508]
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

When you login and it says name on text bar, that’s Login.java
The name on the “welcome” screen is Frames.java
